comments:
Build 20020528

Periodically (often), when I start a program, my threads show up as 
suspended for a brief moment before showing as resumed. When this happens, 
I usually get an InternalException written to my log, complaining about 
error code 13 (THREAD_NOT_SUSPENDED) returned while trying to compute 
information about stack frames. This exception is written for each stack 
frame in each thread, making a real mess in the log.

The real problem is addressed in Bug 15212. As an interim solution, we 
should not log this exception.

!ENTRY org.eclipse.jdt.debug 4 5010 May 28, 2002 16:34:55.49
!MESSAGE com.sun.jdi.InternalException: Got error code in reply: 13 
occurred retrieving this from stack frame.
!STACK 0
com.sun.jdi.InternalException: Got error code in reply: 13
	at 
org.eclipse.jdi.internal.MirrorImpl.defaultReplyErrorHandler(MirrorImpl.java:255)
	at

	at

	at

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 15212 ***
